title: Suspect in fatal Adams County strip club shootout faces multiple charges
content:
To view this page ensure that Adobe Flash Player version 10.2.0 or greater is installed.
A man allegedly involved in a fatal shootout at an Adams County strip club has been charged with seven counts of attempted first-degree murder.
Adrian Sandoval, 20, is also charged with a crime-of-violence sentencing enhancer, according to the Adams County district attorney’s office.
Sandoval allegedly fired shots from a moving vehicle at seven people standing in front of and inside the Player’s Club, 6710 Federal Blvd., according to a district attorney’s news release.
The shooting happened at about 4:30 a.m. Sunday, after Sandoval and companions were told to leave the bar, prosecutors said. A person in the vehicle with Sandoval was killed by gunfire from a security guard.
Sandoval, who is being held at the Adams County jail in lieu of $500,000 bail, appeared Wednesday afternoon in court. A preliminary hearing is scheduled for Feb. 1.
